question: ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕ ржПржмржВ ржЗрждрж╛рж▓рж┐рждрзЗ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржВржХ рж╕рзНржЯрзЗржЯржорзЗржирзНржЯ ржПрж░ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржкрж╛рж░рзЗ FDR ржжрзЗржЦрж╛рж▓рзЗ рж╣ржмрзЗ ржирж╛? ржирж╛ржХрж┐ ржжрзБржЗржЯрж╛ ржПржорзНржмрж╛рж╕рж┐рждрзЗ рж╕рзЗржнрж┐ржВрж╕ ржПржХрж╛ржЙржирзНржЯ ржерж╛ржХрж▓рзЗ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБржЯрж╛ ржирж┐рж░рж╛ржкржж ржерж╛ржХрж╛ ржпрж╛ржпрж╝ ржЗржирж╢рж╛рж▓рзНрж▓рж╛рж╣!
answer: FDR ржерж╛ржХрж▓рзЗ рж╕рзЗржЯрж┐ рж░рж╛ржЦрзБржи, рждрж╛рж░ ржкрж╛рж╢рж╛ржкрж╛рж╢рж┐ ржХрж┐ржЫрзБ ржЕрж░рзНрже savings account-ржП рж░рж╛ржЦрзБржи, ржжрзБржЯрзЛ ржорж┐рж▓рж┐рзЯрзЗ тАЬaccessible financial proofтАЭ рж╣рж┐рж╕рзЗржмрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрж╛ржи тАФ рждрж╛рж╣рж▓рзЗржЗ ржЗржирж╢рж╛рж▓рзНрж▓рж╛рж╣ ржжрзБржЗ ржжрзЗрж╢рзЗржЗ ржирж┐рж░рж╛ржкржж ржерж╛ржХржмрзЗред

question: ржмрж╛ржВрж▓рж╛ржжрзЗрж╢ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржлрзНрж░рзЗржЮрзНржЪ B2 ржХржорзНржкрж▓рж┐ржЯ ржХрж░рзЗ рждрж╛рж░ ржкрж░ ржХрж┐ ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕рзЗ ржкрзЬрждрзЗ ржпрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржпрж╛ржмрзЗ? ржврж╛ржХрж╛рзЯ ржлрж░рж╛рж╕рж┐ ржнрж╛рж╖рж╛ ржХрзЛржерж╛рзЯ рж╢рзЗржЦрж╛ ржпрж╛рзЯ? ржпрж╛рждрзЗ ржХрж░рзЗ ржлрзНрж░рзЗржЮрзНржЪ ржЯржЯ ржкрзНрж░рзЛржЧрзНрж░рж╛ржорзЗ ржкрзЬрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рж┐ред
answer:
ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ ржпржжрж┐ ржлрзНрж░рзЗржЮрзНржЪ B2 ржХржоржкрзНрж▓рж┐ржЯ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ ржПржмржВ DELF рж╕рж╛рж░рзНржЯрж┐ржлрж┐ржХрзЗржЯ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ ржЖржкржирж┐ рж╕рж░рж╛рж╕рж░рж┐ ржХрзНржпрж╛ржорзНржкрж╛рж╕ ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕ ржмрж╛ржВрж▓рж╛ржжрзЗрж╢ ржПрж░ ржЕржлрж┐рж╕рзЗ ржпрзЛржЧрж╛ржпрзЛржЧ ржХрж░рзБржиред ржлрзНрж░рзЗржЮрзНржЪ ржХрж╛рж░рж┐ржХрзБрж▓рж╛ржо ржП ржкрзЬрждрзЗ ржЪрж╛ржЗрж▓рзЗ рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржЖржкржирж╛ржХрзЗ ржпржерж╛ржпрже ржЗржирзНрж╕ржЯрзНрж░рж╛ржХрж╢ржи ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрж┐ржмрзЗред

answer: ржлрзНрж░рзЗржЮрзНржЪ ржнрж╛рж╖рж╛ ржирж╛ ржЬрж╛ржирж▓рзЗ ржЪрж╛ржХрзБрж░рж┐рж░ рж╕рзБржпрзЛржЧ ржЦрзБржмржЗ ржХржоред  IT ржПржмржВ рж╕ржлржЯржУрзЯрзНржпрж╛рж░ ржлрж┐рж▓рзНржбрзЗ ржЕржирзЗржХрзЗржЗ ржЗржВрж░рзЗржЬрж┐ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗржЗ ржЬржм ржорзНржпрж╛ржирзЗржЬ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗ, ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржмрж┐ржЬржирзЗрж╕, ржорж╛рж░рзНржХрзЗржЯрж┐ржВ, ржХрж┐ржВржмрж╛ ржЖрж░рзНржЯрж╕ ржлрж┐рж▓рзНржбрзЗ рж╕ржорзНржнржм ржирзЯред ржЗржЮрзНржЬрж┐ржирж┐рзЯрж╛рж░рж┐ржВ ржмрж╛ STEM ржПрж░ рж╕рзНржЯрзБржбрзЗржирзНржЯ рж░рж╛ ржЗржирзНржбрж╛рж╕рзНржЯрзНрж░рж┐рждрзЗ ржЬржм ржирж╛ ржкрзЗрж▓рзЗ рж░рж┐рж╕рж╛рж░рзНрж╕ ржЬржм ржмрж╛ ржкрж┐ржПржЗржЪржбрж┐ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ рж╕рзБржпрзЛржЧ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ ржпрзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржЗржВрж░рзЗржЬрж┐рждрзЗржЗ ржХрж╛ржЬ ржЪрж╛рж▓рж╛ржирзЛ ржпрж╛рзЯред ржЖрж░ рждрж╛ржЗ ржЖрж╕рж▓рзЗ ржнрж╛рж╖рж╛ рж╢рж┐ржЦрж╛рж░ ржорж╛ржирж╖рж┐ржХрждрж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЖрж╕рждрзЗ рж╣ржмрзЗ, ржжрзЗрж╢ ржерзЗржХрзЗ рж╢рж┐ржЦрзЗ ржЖрж╕рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рж▓рзЗ ржЖрж░рзЛ ржнрж╛рж▓ред

question: ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕рзЗ PHD рж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржХрж┐ ржкрзНрж░ржлрзЗрж╕рж░ ржПрж░ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ ржХржиржЯрж╛ржХрзНржЯ ржХрж░рждрзЗ рж╣ржмрзЗ?
answer: рж╣рзНржпрж╛ржБ, ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕рзЗ PhD ржХрж░рждрзЗ рж╣рж▓рзЗ ржкрзНрж░ржлрзЗрж╕рж░рзЗрж░ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржХржиржЯрж╛ржХрзНржЯ ржХрж░рж╛ ржкрзНрж░рж╛рзЯ ржмрж╛ржзрзНржпрждрж╛ржорзВрж▓ржХ , ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕рзЗ PhD рж╣рж▓рзЛ ржПржХржЯрж╛ research job contract тАФ ржЕрж░рзНржерж╛рзО, ржЖржкржирж┐ ржПржХрж╕рж╛ржерзЗ student + researcher + employee рж╣рж┐рж╕рзЗржмрзЗ ржерж╛ржХржЫрзЗржиред ржЖрж░ рждрж╛ржЗ ржкрзНрж░ржлрзЗрж╕рж░ ржПрж░ ржХрж╛ржЬрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржХржЧрзНрж░рж╛ржЙржирзНржб ржПрж▓рж╛ржЗржи ржХрж┐ржирж╛ рждрж╛ ржЖрж▓рзЛржЪржирж╛ ржХрж░рзЗ ржирж┐рждрзЗ рж╣рзЯред

question: ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕рзЗ ржХрж┐ рж╕рж╛рж░рзНржЯрж┐ржлрж┐ржХрзЗржЯ equivalent ржЯрж╛ржЗржк ржХрзЛржи ржкрзНрж░рж╕рзЗрж╕ ржЖржЫрзЗ?  (Comparability and Verification)
answer: ржирж╛рж╣, рж╕рж╛рж░рзНржЯрж┐ржлрж┐ржХрзЗржЯ ржЗржнрж╛рж▓рзБрзЯрзЗрж╢ржи ржПрж░ ржХрзЛржи ржкрзНрж░рзЯрзЛржЬржи ржирзЗржЗред ржЗржВрж░рзЗржЬрж┐ ржкрзНрж░рзЛржЧрзНрж░рж╛ржорзЗ ржкрзЬрждрзЗ ржЖрж╕рж▓рзЗ ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ рж╕рж╛рж░рзНржЯрж┐ржлрж┐ржХрзЗржЯ ржЗржВрж░рзЗржЬрж┐рждрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрж▓рзЗржЗ рж╣рж▓ред

question: MOI ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж┐ ржлрзНрж░рж╛ржирзНрж╕рзЗрж░ ржкрж╛ржмрж▓рж┐ржХ ржЗржЙржирж┐ржнрж╛рж░рзНрж╕рж┐ржЯрж┐ рждрзЗ ржорж╛рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░рзНрж╕ ржХрж░рж╛ ржпрж╛ржмрзЗ? ржХрж┐ржВржмрж╛ ржХрзЛржи Scholarship ржХрж┐ ржкрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржпрж╛ржмрзЗ?
answer: Yes you can apply with MOI. But perhaps not so many universities will allow it. You need to search for programs in which you can apply with MOI. We always encourage students to apply with IELTS. It opens more possibilities for getting acceptance from universities. For Scholarships and getting positive VISA decisions, IELTS/TOEFL or any standard english language test is required.

question: What is the visa ratio in France?
answer: From Bangladesh visa ratio of Bachelors applicants are quite low, either you dont have proper solvency documents and a strong profile. But for Masters visa ratio is quite good.

question: How many intakes in France?
answer: Generally there are two intakes. September and February. But, there are very few english taught programs in February intake. Most of them are in Private Universities, and visa ratio is low. So, students target for September intakes in Public universities for better visa decisions.

question: February intake possible?
answer:
Already answered in previous question. Possibility is very low from Bangladesh.

February = only Private universities

September = all the universities including Public and Private

question: Can I fly with my spouse with student visa in France?
answer: No, French Embassy Bangladesh does not allow spouse on Student visa , especially for Bachelor & Masters. But PhD students can fly with their spouse.

question: Which program should I apply for, M1 or M2?
answer:
M1 is the first year of masters, and M2 is the 2nd year. M1 courses are generally theoretical and M2 courses are practical. In M2 there is a 5-6 months internship. So technically there is only one semester in M2. French masters entry requirement is 3 years Bachelors, as we do 4 years bachelors in our country, so we can directly apply for M2.

Choose M2 if

- you have relevant job experience of a couple of years

- you want to work in industry 

- you want to finish MasterтАЩs asap

- if you can adapt within a short time, because only 1 semester in M2

Choose M1 if

- If you have a long term goal with PhD

- If you want a strong theoretical basement

- if you are a fresher

- if you wanna do research

- if you need time to adapt

question: Do I need to pay my tuition fees before my visa application in France?
answer: Generally it depends on the University. In France, you can pay tuition fees after coming here in most of the public universities. But for the private universities you need to pay tuition fees from your home country.

question: What documents should be prepared in advance before applying for the study visa?
answer:
University Application Documents :

- CV (EUROPASS)

- Passport 

- NID

- Birth Certificate 

- Transcripts

- Provisional / Main Certificate 

- Recomendation Letter x2

- IELTS/TOEFL

- Motivation Letter (SOP)

- Work Experience Certificate 

- Voluntary Certificate 

- Any Extra Curricular Activities or Achievement Certificate

For Visa Application :

- CV

- Offer Letter

- Motivation Letter 

- Cover Letter (Explaining Financial Solvency) 

- Accomodation Booking

- Scholarship Documents (if any)

- Sponsor Documents (ID)

- Sponsors Bank Statement (minimum 6 months)

- Sponsors Affidavit / Consent Letter (Notarised)

- Asset Evaluation (in some cases)

- Trade Licence (If sponsor have business) 

- Sponsors TAX Certificate 

- Sponsors Salary Certificate 

- Visa Application Form (Filled through Online)

question: For France Student Visa, How long the period of Bank statement should be? Is there any criteria?
answer: Generally Campus France suggest students to show minimum 3 months statement, but students shows minimum 6 months as a safety.

question: For masters how much bank statement money we need to show? 2 years or 1 years cost ?
answer: Tuition Fees + Living Expenses for intended years of study. Varies Program to program. In some offer letter its written that you have to complete M2 after this M1. Then you have to show 2 year. If not this case then you can show 1 years.

question: What types of scholarship are available in Masters programm in France?
answer: Eiffel, IDEX, Erusmus, Graduate Scholarship, Science Po, Ampere etc.

question: What is the best time to take IELTS test for fall intake?
answer: Minimum one month before your application deadline, because sometimes you may need to take exam for 2nd time. For fall intake we suggest to keep score in hand before February.

question: What is the last age limit to get scholarship?
answer: National scholarships have age limits like 27/28 years old. But some regional scholarships may not have age limits. It varies.

question: Any scholarships are possible with MOI?
answer: Unfortunately no, except you are an outstanding candidate.

question: Budget for M1 & M2?
answer: Tuition Fees + Living Cost. One year masters tuition fees are generally 3770-5000 euros in public university. In private its 8000-12000 euros. Living cost varies from city to city. In Paris its almost 750 euros.

question: Which kind of profile is acceptable for scholarship?
answer:
Strong Academic Background, CGPA 3.5+ (out of 4.0). But: A slightly lower CGPA (like 3.2тАУ3.4) can still win scholarships if you have research / leadership / work experience.

Relevant Field and Course Alignment

Language Proficiency : IELTS 6.5тАУ7.0

Motivation + Leadership + Community Work

Research / Internship / Work Experience

question: Can I do Masters with a low CGPA?
answer: Obviously, why not? But you should present proper motivation, alignment with your background with intended program.

question: I have already completed  one year MasterтАЩs degree, including a thesis . If i apply for a second MasterтАЩs,  may i submit the result of my first one?
answer: Yes, It's better to submit if it relates to your intended program of 2nd MasterтАЩs.

question: Which European countries will have good visa ratio for Bangladeshi students in 2026?
answer: France, Finland, Estonia, Italy, Hungary, Germany, Sweden, Netherlands, Denmark.

question: What kind of support do you provide?
answer: Our plan is to guid students for one academic years. During this time we evaluate their profile, upgrade their CV, Linkedin, Portfolio, SOP, Research Proposal and provide 1 to 1 mentoring sessions. Also we suggest them university, program, and scholarships based on their profile.

question: Do you provide any financial support like bank loans or funds?
answer: No, we don't provide any financial support. We only guide the students to prepare those.

question: In which platform do you mentor the students?
answer: Google Meet, Zoom, Microsoft Teams etc.

question: Can I pay your mentoring fees in installments?
answer: Yes, you can pay in 2 installments.

question: WhatтАЩs the requirement of getting citizenship in France? I have heard after finishing 2 years of masters and getting a job will take you to the eligibility
answer:
PR & Citizenship Track for Students in France

ЁЯФ╣ Permanent Residency (Carte de R├йsident тАУ 10 years)

тЮбя╕П Normally after 5 years in France.

тЮбя╕П Reduced to 2 years if you studied & graduated (M1 + M2) in France + have stable job & income.

тЮбя╕П Income should generally be at least SMIC (minimum wage ~ тВм1,400 net/month) and declared in your French tax return.

тЮбя╕П For highly skilled permits (Passeport Talent), the threshold is тЙе 2├Ч SMIC gross (i.e. ~тВм43,000/year).

тЮбя╕П Requires: A2 French Level

ЁЯФ╣ French Citizenship by Naturalization

тЮбя╕П Normally 5 years of residence.

тЮбя╕П Reduced to 2 years if you studied at least 2 years in a French university (M1+M2).

тЮбя╕П Requires: B2 French level/Exam

Stable income (usually тЙе SMIC, declared through annual tax returns),

Salary Consistency over 2тАУ3 years (shown in tax declarations),

тЬЕ Stronger application: тВм1,800тАУтВм2,500 net/month (skilled or professional job)

тнР Very strong file: тЙе тВм3,000 net/month (often Passeport Talent level jobs)

Proof of integration into French society.

ЁЯСЙ NB: Technically these are the general rules and laws. But practically it varies from person to person and sometimes may be lengthy for bureaucratic process.
